content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Fun puzzle!

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Good problem. I love this puzzle !

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Great fun puzzle, well written. I think you could also consider changing the difficulty to easy, since it seems more similar in difficulty to existing easy puzzles, but it's probably fine either way.

Goal
* Please specify that all coordinates use the format (row, column).

* We should avoid introducing new rules within the examples. Please move these *modified* sentences so they appear *before* the examples:

  • The path does not have to be simple, meaning that it can visit the same cell more than once, subject to the self-loop rule below.
  
  • No self-loops are allowed, i.e. the math may not visit the same cell twice (or more) consecutively.

Cases
* Out of the 40 cases (20 tests + 20 validators):

  • 17 cases: startR < goalR and startC < goalC
  
  • 6 cases: startR < goalR and startC > goalC
  
  • 6 cases: startR > goalR and startC < goalC
  
  • 4 cases: startR = goalR and startC < goalC
  
  • 4 cases: startR > goalR and startC > goalC
  
  • 2 cases: startR < goalR and startC = goalC
  
  • 1 case: startR = goalR and startC > goalC
  
  • 0 case: startR > goalR and startC = goalC
  
  Please rebalance the distribution so that different combinations appear with similar frequencies.

Thanks.

Thank you for your detailed feedback.

I have addressed your points regarding the goal section.

Regarding the case distribution, I have modified several test cases. However, because altering the start and goal positions of a few test cases would fundamentally change their nature, the distribution is not perfectly uniform across all eight combinations.
No worries! The balance is much better now. Thank you.
